ygData.subject: Re: Into the Swamps

Teltoli scrubbed a hand over her nose, as if ridding herself of the 
swamp smell. "Well you, being a regular old Swamp-Citizen, would be 
used to it now" She joked.

She then giggled at Carnage's 'Rude slagging bugger' in reference to 
the other raptor. "I seem to remember a 'Rage' from somewhere. 
CyberClaw? Sounds a bit more familiar.." She gave up and shrugged. 
"Who'd -want- to remember her anyway?"

Her shoulders then slumped in defeat. She was still a kid. A little 
kid who knew nothing about hard war, or even much fighting. Sure, she 
had a gun, she knew how to use it. 'But a gun didn't make one a 
Warrior, it was your skill'. Or.. that's how her Father had said it. 
Maybe it was 'It's not the sword that makes you a fighter, but your 
honor'? Or something..

Teltoli breathed out heavily. "Yeah I know, I've got a lot to learn. 
My Father was all for teaching me, but my Mother.. really wanted me 
to become a Noble. You know, lifting tea cups with your little finger 
out, posh accent and so on. But.. Dad.. he enrolled me in the army. 
Boy was Mum mad about that" She chuckled.

"Back when I was little, Dad always used to say something when he 
came home from fighting in the army.." The Fuzor shook her head, 
trying to remember the saying. "I never understood it, until 
Commander Orion made us learn hand-tohand fighting"

"I think it was.. 'The speed of the hand decieves the eye, and more 
often that not, what blackens it'" She chuckled. "Every single day I 
heard that, when Mum was fussing over some tiny scratch he may have 
received. When I asked what it meant, Mum was horrified. I still 
remember the look on her face"

Teltoli sighed again. Was she getting homesick? Naahhh.. she had seen 
her parents at the promotion party. Nostalgic much? She grimaced.

"The only bad thing about Earth is the .. range of food. Not that the 
processed food on Cybertron was nice-tasting or anything.." She 
shrugged.
